design.name: Design
design.info: I picked up design about two years ago, creating snapchat geofilters for fun. However I soon realized how important of a problem solving tool it could be.

work1.name: Hello LA
work1.info: In February 2016 I attended my first hackathon, Hack@Brown. Working with LA locals, we created a curated guide to Los Angeles, and won best user experience out of ~100 teams.

work2.name: Scout Site
work2.info: During spring of 2016 I joined Scout studio as a designer, and worked on a team tasked with redesigning and creating Scout's website. We started with a brand dive, assessing the current state of Scout and its collateral, and from there moved onto sketching, wireframing, high fidelity mockups, and eventually coding.

work3.name: MyHousing
work3.info: In spring 2016 I took the class design: process, context, and systems. This introductory course explored the core ideas of design thinking and user-focused design. For our final project we were tasked with finding an frustrating user experience we've encountered while at NU, and try to design a smarter solution to it.

dev.name: Code
dev.info: I've been coding for about 4 years, mostly for class. It's time-consuming, frustrating, and repetitive, but the small dopamine release from solving challenging problems draws me back like a moth to a flame. These are some of my favorite projects or the past few years.

photo.name: Photo
photo.info: I got my first camera in 2011. None of these photos are from 2011. Trust me, you dont want to see them. I love capturing the beauty of everyday life, and photography is a perfect tool to do so.

video.name: Video
video.info: I started playing around with video in 2014. I quickly discovered a strong passion for filmmaking, and spent about a year fully dedicated to the craft.
